intro: Trema levigatum, commonly known as the smooth trema, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Trema levigatum is known for its ability to tolerate periodic flooding, making it an important component of riparian ecosystems.
